intro: Amblytropis henryi, commonly known as Henry's amblytropis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy odor when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amblytropis henryi is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
